alert.note: Alert for Bonner; Kootenai (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 21 at 1:39PM MST until February 21 at 2:45PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Bonner County in the Panhandle of Idaho... North central Kootenai County in the Panhandle of Idaho... * Until 145 PM PST. * At 1238 PM PST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Priest River to 10 miles northeast of Athol, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 444 and 464. U.S. Highway 2 in Idaho between mile markers 1 and 18. Locations impacted include... Priest River, Spirit Lake, Athol, Oldtown, Cocolalla, Laclede, Bayview, Careywood and Blanchard. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.
